thread.title: Maha millers to shut shop

author: tribuneindia.com
title: Maha millers to shut shop
text:
Mumbai, October 17
Pulses millers in Maharashtra have suspended operations due to shortage of pulses caused by drought. Merchants at wholesale grain markets in Navi Mumbai and Pune said more than 75 to 80 per cent of the millers had downed their shutters and more could follow suit as stocks (pulses) available for processing dried up. “Millers are no longer finding it profitable to process toor dal and other pulses as they have become more expensive,” says Jayant Maru, a grain merchant at at Navi Mumbai wholesale market. — TNS
